summary: Gale Lynn Oppenberg was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents indicate her employment spanned from at least December 1977 to November 1978. She is mentioned in several payroll certifications and reports detailing her position, annual salary, and pay period earnings. The documents include a Final Determination Notification from the Assassination Records Review Board regarding her payroll records, payroll authorization forms, and memos confirming her start date and salary. These documents primarily serve to verify her employment and compensation during her tenure with the HSCA.
significance: Gale Lynn Oppenberg's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, her payroll records are part of the official documentation related to the HSCA's investigation, contributing to the historical record of the inquiry.
